instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01987: What is 820-01987? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U6903: What is U6903? This chip is responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H in 2016-2018 model Macbook logic boards.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP1V8_SLPS2R: What is PP1V8_SLPS2R? PP1V8_SLPS2R is a 1.8v power rail present when the system is in a SLPS2R state. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.PP1V1_SLPS2R: What is PP1V1_SLPS2R? The PP1V1_SLPS2R power rail in the MacBook schematic provides a 1.1-volt supply in a specific low-power state indicated by the "_SLPS2R" suffix and is used for powering the T2 chip..
definitions.PP3V_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V_G3H_RTC? PP3V_G3H_RTC is a 3v power rail present when the machine is in a G3H mechanical off state that powers the RTC circuit. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V 0Amp
threads.message:
Hi,
i have this board, I can't enter in DFU mode.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12,31V
i have all SLP2R but I have all AWAKE (<SIGNAL>PP3V3_AWAKE</SIGNAL>)
is it normal?
thanks
Best regards

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V 0Amp
threads.message:
If ALL AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages are present, machine should appear in DFU.
SSD voltages also required to complete restore.
Did you follow all the stepst from DFU tutorial?
Any history fault available?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V 0Amp
threads.message:
sorry I forget a word I have all awake except <SIGNAL>PP3V3_AWAKE</SIGNAL>.
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_AWAKE</SIGNAL> is It necessary to enter in DFU?
liquid (near <CHIP>U6903</CHIP>) I reball <CHIP>U6903</CHIP> seems good
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V 0Amp
threads.message:
3V3 AWAKE is also needed, of course.
Post diode mode to ground there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V 0Amp
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V 0Amp
threads.message:
Then <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> shoud be the culprit.
Do you get all other voltages from <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> (SYM 1 OF 4)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V 0Amp
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_PMU_VDDMAIN</SIGNAL>=3,32V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL>=1,8V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>=3,298V
<SIGNAL>PP1V1_SLPS2R</SIGNAL>=1,105V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_PMU_VINRTC_R</SIGNAL>=3,3V

Output:
<SIGNAL>PP0V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL>=0,803V
<SIGNAL>PP3V_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>=3,01V
<SIGNAL>PMU_LDO3_OUT_R</SIGNAL>=1,802V
<SIGNAL>CPU_C10_GATE_L</SIGNAL>=0,01V
<SIGNAL>PP1V_S0SW</SIGNAL>=0,09V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_PMU_VDDMAIN</SIGNAL>=3,32V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_AWAKE</SIGNAL>=0,020V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>=0V

is it liquid spill under <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>? I haven't remove the shield, how can I do? with hot airgun?
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V 0Amp
threads.message:
If no short on <SIGNAL>3V3_AWAKE</SIGNAL>, then <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> has an internal problem, or broken solder.
Search on Youtube, if someone shows how to access that area.
Apply 138 degrees solder paste; it will help you a lot.
